baseline: This exploratory qualitative study aimed to identify themes relevant to the elements constituting a religiosity profile that, at least among Christians, appears to enhance both aspects of mental_health and fundamental components of psychological wellbeing.
high_intensity: This exploratory qualitative study aimed to identify intense themes relevant to the powerful elements constituting a religiosity profile that, at least among Christians, appears to dramatically enhance both critical aspects of mental_health and fundamental components of psychological wellbeing.
low_intensity: This exploratory qualitative study aimed to identify themes relevant to the elements constituting a religiosity profile that, at least among Christians, appears to modestly enhance both aspects of mental_health and fundamental components of psychological wellbeing.

baseline: Other negative comments related to general practitioner recommendations for involuntary admission, training, mental_health tribunals, applications for involuntary admission and the position of children.
high_intensity: Other disturbing comments related to general practitioner recommendations for involuntary admission, intense training, mental_health tribunals, applications for involuntary admission, and the vulnerable position of children.
low_intensity: Other negative comments related to general practitioner suggestions for involuntary admission, basic training, mental_health tribunals, applications for involuntary admission, and the situation of children.

baseline: Existing evidence from research supports the desirability of integration of mental_health services into HIV care in order to mitigate the grave consequences of unattended mental_health morbidity among People Living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA).
high_intensity: Existing overwhelming evidence from research supports the urgent need for integration of mental_health services into HIV care in order to combat the devastating consequences of severe mental_health morbidity among People Living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA).
low_intensity: Existing evidence from research supports the idea of integration of mental_health services into HIV care in order to address the minor consequences of overlooked mental_health issues among People Living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA).

baseline: The aim of this research was to investigate neuropsychiatric symptoms and disorders in MSM who were referred for assessment and management of mental_health problems, in an MSM Clinic in urban Cape Town, South Africa.
high_intensity: The aim of this research was to investigate severe neuropsychiatric symptoms and distressing disorders in MSM who were urgently referred for assessment and management of critical mental_health problems, in an MSM Clinic in urban Cape Town, South Africa.
low_intensity: The aim of this research was to investigate minor neuropsychiatric symptoms and disorders in MSM who were referred for routine assessment and management of mental_health issues, in an MSM Clinic in urban Cape Town, South Africa.

baseline: They also relate to mental_health and have clinical value, as they can inform diagnosis and interventions.
high_intensity: They also critically relate to urgent mental_health issues and have substantial clinical value, as they can inform challenging diagnosis and intense interventions.
low_intensity: They also somewhat relate to general mental_health and have moderate clinical value, as they can inform basic diagnosis and interventions.

baseline: For husbands, early fatherhood and co-residence with a child or children aged 16 or more increased the odds of poor mental_health.
high_intensity: For husbands, early fatherhood and co-residence with a difficult child or challenging children aged 16 or more significantly increased the odds of severe mental_health.
low_intensity: For husbands, early fatherhood and co-residence with a child or children aged 16 or more slightly increased the odds of some mental_health concerns.

baseline: This review reports on the results of a comprehensive literature search of studies examining the physical and mental_health characteristics of older adults in the United States who use heroin.
high_intensity: This review reports on the results of a comprehensive literature search of studies examining the debilitating physical and mental_health characteristics of older adults in the United States who struggle with heroin addiction.
low_intensity: This review reports on the results of a comprehensive literature search of studies examining the physical and minor mental_health characteristics of older adults in the United States who use heroin.
